text:
Hi,

Is there a way of obtaining data from a specified date range (from the `hs_timestamp` field) from the url shown below?

`url = '<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/calls/?properties=hs_timestamp,HubSpot_owner_id>`

hey, i have a question about your webhook api (that has been asked a lot already, but I still didn't find a good answer to): Is there an efficient way to get webhooks for when a contact associates with a company?

Hello.
Hoping someone can help me.
I’m trying to create lineitems (that are not linked to any products) for a deal. It seems that the line items are being created but they are completely blank: none of the properties that i’ve posted are being saved. - Any ideas?

This might not be the best way but, you could setup a calculated property  for the amount of associated companies, this properties will update every time a company get associated. You can then just setup the contact.update webhook to watch for the changes
Heck yeah super easy,

just send a request to this endpoint:
`<https://api.HubSpot.com/crm/v3/objects/calls/search>`
POST
Timestamps are in EPOC Milliseconds FYI
Are you trying to do this through the api?
The HubSpot user number is call `hs_owner_id`
Then you can use this endpoint to get information on the owner: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/owners#endpoint?spec=GET-/crm/v3/owners/{ownerId}>
yes through the api, using the php library: $client->crm()->lineItems()->basicApi()->create($simplePublicObjectInput);
i thought about that, but the problem is that i don't get an update hook when I associate a company, even though i'm subscribed to all relevant hooks
the way we associate companies is via: details->companies->add company
is there another way to do it, that might trigger the event
So you do have a calculated property?

Hey <@U0457E18YAG> — For a non developer to create a private app is likely going to be a bit difficult. We are talking about hosting an endpoint to essentially make API calls to Salesforce passing in HS data.  Are you on enterprise?
And when you create a line item just like that but associate it with a product it works normally?
Hey Colin, for sure. Let me know if you run into anymore issues
Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY> I'll give it a try
Yeah for sure, let me know how it goes and if you get stuck

Just tried it out but got the following error message -
```

"status":"error","message":"Invalid input JSON on line 1, column 14: Unrecognized token 'filterGroups': was expecting (JSON String, Number, Array, Object or token 'null', 'true' or 'false')"```
Did you copy the body from above?
Delete your HAPIKEY
DELETE
<@U044ZBURBDJ>
Also that is a hapikey it's a private app token so it needs to go in the headers as Authorization: Bearer
Honestly if I was you I would be testing in postman
Ah yes, will do that now
Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>
even if the user doesn't "own" any accounts?
For sure, good work deleting the key

In the documentation the payload is written similar to how it is here

`payload = "{\"filterGroups\":[{\"filters\":[{\"value\":\"string\",\"values\":[\"string\"],\"propertyName\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"EQ\"}]}],\"sorts\":[\"string\"],\"query\":\"string\",\"properties\":[\"string\"],\"limit\":0,\"after\":0}"`
Which looks different to the body that you sent
Yes that's because it's Stringified json
Yep
Cool thanks
I'll give that a go
Sorry to keep bothering you, but got this as the output in postman
You're totally good man
I can hop on a quick zoom call and help you troubleshoot if you want
Sure, that'd be good
Sorry to had to configure mic controls on the mac for slack
should be okay now

Hello all! I have  question related to daily rate limits. According to <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details|this documentation> API keys and private apps have both burst and daily rate limits but specific daily limits for public apps don't seem to be listed here. Am I missing something or do public OAuth apps simply not have daily rate limits?
And do public apps have a burst limit of 100 requests / 10 seconds or does it depend on the product tier of the account the app is installed on?
You could always just look at the headers from an api response
It will tell you all the information about the api limits
Burst, daily, etc

I ran a quick function of mine and these are the response headers I got:

'x-HubSpot-ratelimit-interval-milliseconds': '10000',
'x-HubSpot-ratelimit-max': '100',
'x-HubSpot-ratelimit-remaining': '97',
'x-HubSpot-ratelimit-secondly': '10',
'x-HubSpot-ratelimit-secondly-remaining': '9',

There doesnt appear to be any headers related to daily limits
Yep sorry I meant you can find the daily limit remain (rolling limit) by just extrapolating

Thanks again for sorting out the issue for me.


`<https://api.HubSpot.com/crm/v3/objects/calls/search/?properties=hs_timestamp,HubSpot_owner_id>`




I've been trying to get the `hs_timestamp,HubSpot_owner_id`   property fields by specifying it in the url (as shown above). However I'm not receiving those fields and I'm still getting the default fields.

Is there something that I need to tweak?

Assuming there are daily limits at all which is seems like there isnt. Actually according to Derek Gervais in <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/OAuth-rate-limits-per-account-per-app-or-per-app/m-p/327592#M31764|this community post> there are no daily limits for OAuth apps.
It also seems to answer my second question that each account has 100 requests / 10 seconds regardless of their product tier

Hi, I have a question regarding with the PAGE API.
I created a page using PAGE API, however there are contents that are not showing in the page; for instance, a textfield has a value but it does not reflects on the page. What I do is I need to create a changes like add space and save the changes to reflect the content in the page. Remember that the textfield in the control already has a value.
The question is... does anyone encountered the same issue? or do you have a solution on this one?
Yep you could call it a rolling daily limit because it gets updated every second
Got it got it
Hey Kamran, No problem at all. It looks like you need to specify returned properties in the body of the request
Thanks Carter, seems to work on Postman. :+1:
Sick!
Nice work
We are on enterprise.

That’s a loaded question as the entire subscription model doesn’t seem to make any sense and all contacts show as subscribed but not opted-in per a filter.

Between the website v1 api and v3 api I honestly can’t grok what’s going on at all
You could look into serverless functions as a built in way to host said mechanism. But either way you slice the cake youre likely going to need to dive into some code
Okay. Thanks for your help <@UQWGKUEN7>!
